articles.title: Amazon blocks 1,800 job applications from suspected North Korean agents
articles.summary: The firm’s chief security officer said North Koreans tried to apply for remote working IT jobs using stolen or fake identities.
articles.reasoning: The article details Amazon's use of AI tools and staff verification to screen job applications, addressing IT security, identity management, and fraud prevention—core aspects of IT Governance.

articles.title: UK social media campaigners among five denied US visas
articles.summary: The Trump administration bans five people who have called for tech regulation from entering the country.
articles.reasoning: The article discusses campaigns for tech regulation and content moderation on digital platforms, which directly relates to IT governance frameworks and policies for managing technology use, risks, and compliance.

articles.title: TikTok removes AI weight loss ads from fake Boots account
articles.summary: The adverts for prescription-only drugs showed healthcare professionals impersonating the British retailer.
articles.reasoning: The article discusses TikTok's platform policies, content moderation, and enforcement actions regarding AI-generated ads, which relates to IT governance frameworks for managing technology use, compliance, and risk.

articles.title: Uber and Lyft announce plans to trial Chinese robotaxis in UK in 2026
articles.summary: Baidu's Apollo Go robotaxis have already accrued millions of driverless rides in cities worldwide.
articles.reasoning: The partnerships aim to transform travel and provide new mobility options, implying expected benefits like improved services or efficiency, though the article focuses more on announcements and trials rather than measured outcomes.
